CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1965, pg. 7A reads: "Marching To New Calvary - The labors, hopes and dreams of two generations came to full fruition, recently, as the pastor, officers and members of Calvary Baptist Church, formerly located at 1036 Penn Ave., marched into their new church home at 1511 Swissvale Ave., Wilkinsburg. The commodious new building has a well equipped sanctuary, twelve classrooms, three pianos, a Hammond electric organ, gymnasium, a large parking facility and sufficient grounds fro future expansion.  The Rev. S.D. Bonaparte, inset, is the pastor whose guiding hand has brought these people to this day of victory.  The Rev. Samuel A. McGill, pastor of St. Mark AME Church, Wilkinsburg,  joined Rev. Bonaparte in march. (Harris Photo).
TitMainTitle: Ten men, including Rev. S.D. Bonaparte wearing light colored necktie, standing at top of stairs of the New Calvary Baptist Church, Swissvale Avenue, Wilkinsburg
